result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Davan E Gathright

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Davan E Gathright in court.  Attorney Eric R. Hart in court for Davan E Gathright.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 2.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

All conditions of bail remain as previously ordered. 

Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 36.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Davan E Gathright in court with attorney Eric R. Hart.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Court advised the defendant that all previously ordered conditions of bail remain in full effect.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-10-2022
filed.

Defendant Davan E Gathright in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Status Conference. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court.  Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Attorney Eric Hart, in court via telephone, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $25.00 per month beginning 9-1-2022, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned, Branch 38.  **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Davan E Gathright in court.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Status of Counsel. Court to appoint Attorney Eric Hart and adjourned the matter. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Status conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Davan E Gathright in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Status of Counsel. Public Defender's office has yet to appoint counsel on this matter. Court will appoint Attorney Eric Hart to this case and adjourned the matter for counsel to accept the appointment. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Status conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Davan E Gathright in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Staus of Counsel. Defendant has not retained private counsel. Defendant remains eligible for public defender appointment. Court advised defendant to have an attorney present at the next court date. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

22RM016153  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
3/23/2022

Defendant Davan E Gathright in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Poznanski is moving to withdraw. Defendant to hire private counsel. Court granted motion to withdraw.  Case is adjourned to 4-14-22 at 8:15 am for status of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court, defendant Davan E Gathright not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense cousnel requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court, defendant Davan E Gathright not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel informed the Court that defendant has a pending case in this court 20CF4164. Parties request matter set on same court date to tag along.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Davan E Gathright in court by video with Attorney Amanda Poznanski who appears in person.  Defendant Davan E Gathright in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer D. Bui.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/ed5b9ae0-0153-fff4-9924-88d8db5a37c1  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered no contact with L.P.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Davan E Gathright in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Davan E Gathright in custody.  Kaitlyn Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
